baptism.subtitle: Baptism preparation
baptism.section1.title: What is baptism?
baptism.section1.content:
Baptism is a sacred ordinance that marks the beginning of your journey as a disciple of Jesus Christ. It is a covenant you make with God, promising to take upon yourself the name of Christ, always remember Him, and keep His commandments. In return, God promises the forgiveness of your sins and the constant companionship of the Holy Ghost.

Baptism is performed by complete immersion in water, symbolizing the death of the natural man and rebirth as a new creature in Christ. It is the first step on the path to eternal life.
baptism.section2.title: What happens on your baptism day (step by step)
baptism.section2.content:
1. You will arrive at the baptism location (may be a baptismal font in the chapel or a place with sufficient water).

2. You will change into special white clothing for baptism.

3. A priesthood holder will baptize you by complete immersion, saying: "[Your name], having been commissioned by Jesus Christ, I baptize you in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost. Amen."

4. After baptism, you will change and return for confirmation.

5. You will receive the gift of the Holy Ghost by the laying on of hands.

6. There will be testimonies and words of welcome from Church members.

7. You will receive a certificate of baptism and confirmation.
baptism.section3.title: Frequently Asked Questions
baptism.section3.content: This section contains answers to common questions about baptism. You can expand each question to see the answer.
baptism.section4.title: The baptismal interview
baptism.section4.content:
The baptismal interview is a reverent conversation with an authorized Church leader. Its purpose is to confirm that:

â€¢ You understand the basic principles of the gospel.
â€¢ You have faith in Jesus Christ and have repented.
â€¢ You are prepared to make and keep sacred covenants.
â€¢ You understand the importance of baptism and confirmation.

It is not a test to fail, but an opportunity to strengthen your faith and ensure you are ready for this important step. The leader will ask you questions about your testimony, your understanding of the gospel, and your commitment to follow Christ.
baptism.section5.title: After baptism
baptism.section5.content:
After your baptism, you will receive the gift of the Holy Ghost by the laying on of hands. This gift allows you to have the constant companionship of the Spirit if you remain worthy.

Each week you will participate in the sacrament (Holy Communion) to renew your baptismal covenants and receive continuous forgiveness.

Your learning journey continues. You will continue studying the Scriptures, attending Church, serving others, and growing in your faith. Baptism is not the end, but the beginning of a life of discipleship and spiritual growth.

Over time, you will be able to participate in additional temple ordinances, which will prepare you for eternal life with your family.
baptism.faq1.q: What if I'm afraid of water?
baptism.faq1.a: If you're afraid of water, talk to the missionaries and Church leaders. They can make special arrangements so you feel comfortable. Baptism is by immersion, but it can always be adapted for people with special needs.
baptism.faq2.q: What happens if I make mistakes after being baptized?
baptism.faq2.a: Making mistakes is part of being human. The gospel teaches us about repentance, which is the process of turning away from sin and turning toward Christ. Through sincere repentance and participation in the sacrament, we can be forgiven and continue to grow.
baptism.faq3.q: Can I invite my family and friends?
baptism.faq3.a: Absolutely! Your baptism is a special occasion and it's wonderful to share it with the people you love. Invite your family, friends, and anyone who wants to be with you on this important moment.
baptism.faq4.q: Do I need to know everything about the gospel before being baptized?
baptism.faq4.a: You don't need to know everything. What's important is to have faith in Jesus Christ, repent of your sins, and be willing to make covenants with God. Learning continues throughout life. Baptism is the beginning, not the end of your spiritual education.
baptism.faq5.a: The Church provides special white clothing for baptism. You only need to bring white underwear and a towel. After baptism, you will change into your normal clothes for confirmation.
baptism.faq6.q: How long does the ceremony last?
baptism.faq6.a: The complete ceremony, including baptism, confirmation, testimonies, and words of welcome, generally lasts between 30 and 60 minutes. It is a special and meaningful moment.

lesson1.title: The Restoration of the Gospel of Jesus Christ
lesson1.topic1: God Is Our Loving Heavenly Father
lesson1.topic1.desc:
God is a real, perfect and glorified Being. He is literally the Father of our spirit. He knows us by name, understands our story and pain, and desires to guide us back to His presence.

Knowing that we are children of God gives meaning to our life, helps us see our worth, and invites us to trust that we are not alone in our trials.
lesson1.topic1.scriptureMain: "The Spirit itself beareth witness with our spirit, that we are the children of God" (Romans 8:16).
lesson1.topic1.more.0: "Shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits, and live?" (Hebrews 12:9).
lesson1.topic1.more.1: "For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son" (John 3:16).
lesson1.topic1.more.2: "Behold, I am Jesus Christ, the Son of God" (3 Nephi 1:14).
lesson1.topic2: The Gospel Blesses Families and Individuals
lesson1.topic2.desc:
The gospel of Jesus Christ does not only change individuals; it transforms homes. When we invite Christ into our home, we learn to forgive, serve, communicate with love, and face trials together.

God designed the family as the primary place where we learn to love, keep His commandments, and prepare for eternal life.
lesson1.topic2.scriptureMain: "Pray in your families unto the Father, always in my name, that your wives and your children may be blessed" (3 Nephi 18:21).
lesson1.topic2.more.0: "The home is the most important place on earth" (Modern prophetic teaching).
lesson1.topic2.more.1: "If ye build on my rock, ye cannot fall" (Helaman 5:12).
lesson1.topic3: Our Heavenly Father Reveals His Gospel
lesson1.topic3.desc:
God has never left His children without guidance. From the beginning He has called prophets to teach His gospel, warn of spiritual danger, and testify of Jesus Christ.

Revelation through prophets ensures that truth is clear and that the Church of the Lord has divine direction, not only human opinion.
lesson1.topic3.scriptureMain: "Surely the Lord God will do nothing, but he revealeth his secret unto his servants the prophets" (Amos 3:7).
lesson1.topic3.more.0: "Built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets" (Ephesians 2:20).
lesson1.topic3.more.1: "Whether by mine own voice or by the voice of my servants, it is the same" (Doctrine and Covenants 1:38).
lesson1.topic4.desc:
During His earthly ministry, Jesus organized a Church with apostles, prophets, ordinances, authority, and clear doctrine. His Church had unity, revelation, and one faith and one baptism.

Over time that perfect organization was lost from the earth, making a restoration necessary, not just a reform.
lesson1.topic4.scriptureMain: "And are built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ himself being the chief corner stone" (Ephesians 2:20).
lesson1.topic4.more.2: "Upon this rock I will build my church" (Matthew 16:18).
lesson1.topic5.desc:
After the death of Jesus Christ and His apostles, many rejected the prophets and the authority of the priesthood was lost. Doctrines and ordinances were changed, and spiritual confusion arose.

Apostasy does not mean that all people were wicked, but that the true Church with living prophets and divine authority was no longer on the earth.
lesson1.topic5.scriptureMain: "That day shall not come, except there come a falling away first" (2 Thessalonians 2:3).
lesson1.topic5.more.0: "I will send a famine in the land... of hearing the words of the Lord" (Amos 8:11).
lesson1.topic5.more.1: "Having a form of godliness, but denying the power thereof" (2 Timothy 3:5).
lesson1.topic5.more.2: "There shall arise false Christs, and false prophets" (Matthew 24:24).
lesson1.topic6.desc:
God did not abandon His children. In the latter days He prepared the way to restore the original Church of Jesus Christ, with the same authority, doctrine, and ordinances.

The Restoration is not just a nice idea; it is God's real act of placing back on the earth everything that had been lost after the apostasy.
lesson1.topic6.scriptureMain: "And I saw another angel fly in the midst of heaven, having the everlasting gospel" (Revelation 14:6).
lesson1.topic6.more.0: "In the dispensation of the fulness of times" (Ephesians 1:10).
lesson1.topic6.more.1: "A marvelous work and a wonder" (2 Nephi 27:26).
lesson1.topic6.more.2: "I will proceed to do a marvelous work" (Isaiah 29:14).
lesson1.topic7.desc:
The authority to act in the name of God is called the priesthood. It was lost during the Great Apostasy and was restored by heavenly messengers to Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery.

Without the priesthood there are no valid baptisms, confirmations, or saving ordinances. With the restored priesthood, the Church once again has divine authority.
lesson1.topic7.scriptureMain: "And no man taketh this honour unto himself, but he that is called of God" (Hebrews 5:4).
lesson1.topic7.more.0: Doctrine and Covenants 13:1, restoration of the Aaronic Priesthood.
lesson1.topic7.more.1: Joseph Smithâ€”History 1:68â€“72, account of priesthood restoration.
lesson1.topic7.more.2: Doctrine and Covenants 27:12â€“13, keys restored by ancient apostles.
lesson1.topic8.desc:
The Book of Mormon is another testament of Jesus Christ. It contains the teachings of ancient prophets who lived in the Americas and bears powerful witness of the divinity of the Savior.

Read with a sincere heart and prayer, it invites the Holy Ghost, clarifies doctrine, and confirms that the Restoration is real.
lesson1.topic8.scriptureMain: "And we talk of Christ, we rejoice in Christ" (2 Nephi 25:26).
lesson1.topic8.more.0: 2 Nephi 29, prophecy of a second witness.
lesson1.topic8.more.2: Title page of the Book of Mormon, purpose of the record.
lesson1.topic9.desc:
God invites every person to sincerely ask if these things are true. He answers through the Holy Ghost with feelings of peace, joy, clarity, and a desire to do good.

We are not asked to believe blindly but to go directly to the Source of all truth and receive a personal answer.
lesson1.topic9.scriptureMain: "By the power of the Holy Ghost ye may know the truth of all things" (Moroni 10:5).
lesson1.topic9.more.0: "If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God" (James 1:5).
lesson1.topic9.more.1: "Ask, and it shall be given you" (Matthew 7:7).
lesson1.topic9.more.2: "Behold, I stand at the door, and knock" (Revelation 3:20).
lesson2.title: The Plan of Salvation
lesson2.topic1.desc:
Before we were born, we lived with God as His spirit children. There we learned, progressed, and accepted the plan to come to earth.

Understanding premortal life helps us know that our existence has an eternal purpose and that we are not accidents.
lesson2.topic1.scriptureMain: "Before I formed thee in the belly I knew thee" (Jeremiah 1:5).
lesson2.topic1.more.2: Modern teaching: we are beloved spirit sons and daughters of God.
lesson2.topic2.desc:
On earth we receive a physical body, are tested, and learn to choose between good and evil. Life is an opportunity to draw closer to Christ and prepare to live with God again.

Though there is pain and trial, all things can work together for our good as we trust in the Savior.
lesson2.topic2.scriptureMain: "Men are, that they might have joy" (2 Nephi 2:25).
lesson2.topic2.more.0: "This life is the time for men to prepare to meet God" (Alma 34:32).
lesson2.topic2.more.1: "In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world" (John 16:33).
lesson2.topic3: The Fall of Adam and Eve
lesson2.topic3.desc:
The Fall was not an accident but part of God's plan. Because of it we can have families, experience opposition, and understand our need for the Savior.

Adam and Eve chose to leave God's presence so that we could come to earth and progress.
lesson2.topic3.scriptureMain: "Adam fell that men might be; and men are, that they might have joy" (2 Nephi 2:25).
lesson2.topic3.more.1: Moses 4â€“5, revealed explanation of the Fall.
lesson2.topic3.more.2: "By the offence of one judgment came upon all men" (Romans 5:18).
lesson2.topic4.desc:
Jesus Christ is the center of the plan of salvation. Through His Atonement He suffered our sins, pains, sicknesses and sorrows, and overcame death.

Because of Him we can be forgiven, healed, and resurrected, and have hope even in our hardest trials.
lesson2.topic4.scriptureMain: Alma 7:11â€“13, Christ takes upon Him the pains of His people.
lesson2.topic4.more.2: "I am the resurrection, and the life" (John 11:25).
lesson2.topic5.desc:
After death our spirit continues to live in the spirit world. There is a place of peace for the righteous and a state of learning for those who still need to accept the gospel.

Missionary work continues there, showing God's mercy for all His children.
lesson2.topic5.scriptureMain: "For for this cause was the gospel preached also to them that are dead" (1 Peter 4:6).
lesson2.topic5.more.0: Alma 40, state of the soul between death and resurrection.
lesson2.topic5.more.1: Doctrine and Covenants 138, vision of the spirit world.
lesson2.topic6.desc:
Resurrection is the reuniting of spirit and body in a perfect, immortal form. Because of Jesus Christ, all will be resurrected, both just and unjust.

The Resurrection assures that death is not the end but a step in God's plan.
lesson2.topic6.scriptureMain: "For as in Adam all die, even so in Christ shall all be made alive" (1 Corinthians 15:22).
lesson2.topic6.more.1: "I am the resurrection, and the life" (John 11:25).
lesson2.topic7.desc:
God has prepared different degrees of glory for His children according to their faith, works, and desires. He did not create a small heaven and a simple eternal hell but multiple opportunities for glory.

The celestial kingdom is for those who make and keep covenants with Christ; the other kingdoms also reflect His mercy and justice.
lesson2.topic7.more.0: Doctrine and Covenants 76, vision of the degrees of glory.
lesson2.topic7.more.1: "In my Father's house are many mansions" (John 14:2).
lesson2.topic7.more.2: "He shall judge the world with righteousness" (Psalm 9:8).
lesson3.title: The Gospel of Jesus Christ
lesson3.topic1.desc:
Faith in Jesus Christ is more than believing that He exists; it is trusting Him enough to obey His commandments and follow His example.

True faith leads us to act: we pray, change habits, and turn to the Savior in all things.
lesson3.topic1.scriptureMain: "For by grace are ye saved through faith" (Ephesians 2:8).
lesson3.topic1.more.1: Alma 32, faith compared to a seed.
lesson3.topic2.desc:
Repentance is the loving process by which God helps us change. It is not only feeling guilt but turning to Christ, abandoning sin, and receiving forgiveness.

When we sincerely repent, the Lord cleanses our soul and gives us strength not to go back.
lesson3.topic2.scriptureMain: "He who has repented of his sins, the same is forgiven" (Doctrine and Covenants 58:42).
lesson3.topic2.more.0: "Though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow" (Isaiah 1:18).
lesson3.topic2.more.2: "His arm of mercy is extended" (2 Nephi 28:32).
lesson3.topic3.desc:
Baptism by immersion, performed by proper authority, is the gate that leads into the path of discipleship. It symbolizes the death and resurrection of Christ and our commitment to follow Him.

Through baptism we enter into sacred covenants and receive remission of sins.
lesson3.topic3.scriptureMain: "Repent, and be baptized every one of you" (Acts 2:38).
lesson3.topic3.more.0: John 3:5, born of water and of the Spirit.
lesson3.topic4: The Gift of the Holy Ghost
lesson3.topic4.desc:
After baptism we receive the gift of the Holy Ghost by the laying on of hands. This gift allows us to have the constant companionship of the Spirit if we remain worthy.

The Holy Ghost comforts, guides, testifies of truth, and helps us recognize the voice of the Lord.
lesson3.topic4.scriptureMain: "And ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost" (Acts 2:38).
lesson3.topic4.more.0: Doctrine and Covenants 130:22â€“23, nature of the Spirit.
lesson3.topic4.more.1: 3 Nephi 19, the disciples receive the Holy Ghost.
lesson3.topic4.more.2: "He will guide you into all truth" (John 16:13).
lesson3.topic5.desc:
The gospel is not a one-time event but a lifelong journey. Enduring to the end means continuing in faith, repentance, obedience, and covenant keeping.

God does not demand instant perfection but steady, sincere faithfulness.
lesson3.topic5.scriptureMain: "He that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved" (Matthew 24:13).
lesson3.topic5.more.0: 2 Nephi 31:20, pressing forward with a steadfastness in Christ.
lesson3.topic5.more.1: Mosiah 5:8â€“9, retaining the name of Christ.
lesson3.topic5.more.2: "Let us not be weary in well doing" (Galatians 6:9).
lesson3.topic6.desc:
The ordinances of the gospel are sacred acts performed by priesthood authority. They include baptism, confirmation, the sacrament, and other saving ordinances.

Through ordinances we make covenants with God and receive spiritual power.
lesson3.topic6.scriptureMain: "In the ordinances thereof, the power of godliness is manifest" (Doctrine and Covenants 84:20).
lesson3.topic6.more.0: Doctrine and Covenants 20:73â€“79, baptismal and sacrament prayers.
lesson3.topic6.more.1: 3 Nephi 18, the Savior institutes the sacrament.
lesson3.topic7.desc:
A covenant is a sacred agreement between God and His children. God sets the conditions and promises blessings; we promise obedience and faithfulness.

Covenants define us as disciples of Christ and connect us to His power.
lesson3.topic7.scriptureMain: "Ye shall be my people, and I will be your God" (Jeremiah 30:22).
lesson3.topic7.more.0: Mosiah 5, the people enter into a covenant.
lesson3.topic7.more.1: Doctrine and Covenants 82:10, the Lord is bound when we do what He says.
lesson3.topic7.more.2: "Ye are the children of the covenant" (3 Nephi 20:26).
lesson4.title: The Commandments
lesson4.topic1.desc:
God does not give commandments to restrict us but to protect and guide us toward true happiness. Each commandment reflects His love and wisdom.

When we trust Him and obey, we open the door to blessings we could not obtain otherwise.
lesson4.topic1.scriptureMain: "If ye love me, keep my commandments" (John 14:15).
lesson4.topic1.more.0: "In keeping of them there is great reward" (Psalm 19:11).
lesson4.topic1.more.1: Mosiah 2:41, happiness of those who keep the commandments.
lesson4.topic1.more.2: Doctrine and Covenants 82:10, the Lord is bound when we obey.
lesson4.topic2.desc:
The Ten Commandments are basic principles of love for God and neighbor. They forbid idolatry, blasphemy, murder, adultery, stealing, lying, and coveting.

Keeping them strengthens character, protects families, and creates a more just society.
lesson4.topic2.more.0: "Thou shalt love the Lord thy God" (Matthew 22:37).
lesson4.topic2.more.1: "Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself" (Matthew 22:39).
lesson4.topic3.desc:
The Sabbath day is a holy day dedicated to worshiping God, partaking of the sacrament, resting from worldly labors, and strengthening ourselves spiritually.

When we keep it holy, we feel more of the Lord's peace and receive guidance for the week.
lesson4.topic3.scriptureMain: "Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy" (Exodus 20:8).
lesson4.topic3.more.2: Acts 20:7, disciples meet on the first day of the week.
lesson4.topic4.desc:
The Word of Wisdom is God's law of health. It invites us to avoid alcohol, tobacco, harmful drugs, coffee and tea, and to use wholesome foods.

Obeying this law blesses our body and mind and prepares us to receive more spiritual light.
lesson4.topic4.scriptureMain: Doctrine and Covenants 89, the Word of Wisdom.
lesson4.topic4.more.0: "Given for a principle with promise" (Doctrine and Covenants 89:3).
lesson4.topic4.more.1: "They shall run and not be weary" (Doctrine and Covenants 89:20).
lesson4.topic4.more.2: "Your body is the temple of the Holy Ghost" (1 Corinthians 6:19).
lesson4.topic5.desc:
The law of chastity teaches that sexual relations are sacred and are permitted only between a man and a woman legally and lawfully married.

Keeping this law protects our hearts, minds, and families and allows us to enjoy pure, God-approved intimacy.
lesson4.topic5.more.2: Doctrine and Covenants 121:45, virtue garnish thy thoughts.
lesson4.topic6.desc:
God is a God of truth. Honesty means speaking and acting with integrity, without deceiving or taking advantage of others.

Honesty builds trust and makes us more like Christ.
lesson4.topic6.scriptureMain: "Ye shall not steal, neither deal falsely" (Leviticus 19:11).
lesson4.topic6.more.0: "Lying lips are abomination to the Lord" (Proverbs 12:22).
lesson4.topic6.more.1: Modern teaching: "Be honest in all you do."
lesson4.topic6.more.2: "I am the way, the truth, and the life" (John 14:6).
lesson4.topic7.desc:
Tithing is the law of giving the Lord ten percent of our income. It is an expression of faith and gratitude and allows His work to move forward.

God promises to open the windows of heaven to those who pay an honest tithe.
lesson4.topic7.scriptureMain: "Prove me now herewith... if I will not open you the windows of heaven" (Malachi 3:10).
lesson4.topic7.more.0: "Of all that thou shalt give me I will surely give the tenth unto thee" (Genesis 28:22).
lesson4.topic7.more.1: Doctrine and Covenants 119, law of tithing.
lesson4.topic8.desc:
Serving others is one of the clearest ways to show love to God. When we lift others' burdens, we follow the example of Christ.

Christian service may be simple, but it is always powerful.
lesson4.topic8.scriptureMain: "Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it unto me" (Matthew 25:40).
lesson4.topic8.more.0: Mosiah 2:17, when ye are in the service of your fellow beings ye are in the service of your God.
lesson4.topic9.desc:
Loving our neighbor is the second great commandment. It includes loving family, friends, strangers, and even enemies.

This love is shown through patience, forgiveness, respect, and daily service.
lesson4.topic9.scriptureMain: "Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself" (Matthew 22:39).
lesson4.topic9.more.0: Luke 10:25â€“37, parable of the good Samaritan.
lesson4.topic9.more.1: "Charity is the pure love of Christ" (Moroni 7:47).
lesson4.topic9.more.2: "This is my commandment, That ye love one another" (John 15:12).
lesson5.title: Laws and Ordinances
lesson5.topic1.desc:
Laws are commandments and principles God gives; ordinances are sacred acts performed by priesthood authority.

Both work together to help us make and keep covenants with God.
lesson5.topic1.scriptureMain: "In the ordinances thereof, the power of godliness is manifest" (Doctrine and Covenants 84:20).
lesson5.topic1.more.0: Articles of Faith 1:3â€“4, grace, ordinances, and gospel.
lesson5.topic1.more.1: Doctrine and Covenants 20:25â€“27, duties of the Church.
lesson5.topic1.more.2: "Blessed are they that hear the word of God, and keep it" (Luke 11:28).
lesson5.topic2.desc:
The priesthood is the authority and power of God delegated to man to bless His children. It is not taken upon oneself; it is received by ordination.

Through the priesthood, saving ordinances are performed and the Church is directed.
lesson5.topic2.scriptureMain: "No man taketh this honour unto himself, but he that is called of God" (Hebrews 5:4).
lesson5.topic2.more.0: Doctrine and Covenants 13, restoration of the Aaronic Priesthood.
lesson5.topic2.more.1: Doctrine and Covenants 107, organization of the priesthood.
lesson5.topic2.more.2: "Whatsoever thou shalt bind on earth shall be bound in heaven" (Matthew 16:19).
lesson5.topic3.desc:
Essential ordinances include baptism, confirmation, priesthood ordination (for worthy men), the temple endowment, and eternal marriage (sealing).

These ordinances are linked to covenants that prepare us for eternal life.
lesson5.topic3.scriptureMain: "Except a man be born of water and of the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God" (John 3:5).
lesson5.topic3.more.0: Articles of Faith 1:4, ordinances of the gospel.
lesson5.topic3.more.1: Doctrine and Covenants 128:18, welding link between generations.
lesson5.topic3.more.2: "In my Father's house are many mansions" (John 14:2).
lesson5.topic4.desc:
Baptism by immersion and confirmation, in which we receive the gift of the Holy Ghost, are ordinances of entry into the Church of Jesus Christ.

Both must be performed by proper authority to be valid before God.
lesson5.topic4.scriptureMain: "Repent, and be baptized... and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost" (Acts 2:38).
lesson5.topic4.more.1: Doctrine and Covenants 20:37, requirements for baptism.
lesson5.topic4.more.2: Doctrine and Covenants 33:11â€“12, baptize and confer the Holy Ghost.
lesson5.topic5.desc:
The sacrament is a weekly ordinance in which we remember the Atonement of Jesus Christ and renew our baptismal covenants.

Worthily partaking of the sacrament allows us to receive daily forgiveness and the companionship of the Spirit.
lesson5.topic5.scriptureMain: 3 Nephi 18, the Savior institutes the sacrament among the Nephites.
lesson5.topic5.more.0: Doctrine and Covenants 20:77, sacrament prayer for the bread.
lesson5.topic5.more.1: Doctrine and Covenants 20:79, sacrament prayer for the water.
lesson5.topic6.desc:
In the temple, sacred ordinances are performed that relate to our eternal preparation and the exaltation of families. These ordinances focus on Jesus Christ and the plan of salvation.

We do not discuss them in detail outside the temple because they are sacred, not secret.
lesson5.topic6.scriptureMain: "Sanctify my house, that it may be holy" (Doctrine and Covenants 88:119, adapted).
lesson5.topic6.more.0: Doctrine and Covenants 124:39, ordinances for the glory of God.
lesson5.topic6.more.2: "Out of Zion shall go forth the law" (Isaiah 2:3).
lesson5.topic7.desc:
The temple endowment is a sacred ordinance in which we learn more about God's plan, make additional covenants, and receive promised spiritual power.

We speak of it reverently and prepare spiritually to participate worthily.
lesson5.topic7.scriptureMain: "Until ye be endued with power from on high" (Luke 24:49).
lesson5.topic7.more.0: Doctrine and Covenants 95:8, promise of endowment.
lesson5.topic7.more.1: Doctrine and Covenants 109, Kirtland Temple dedication.
lesson5.topic7.more.2: Modern teaching: the temple is a school of eternity.
lesson6.title: Preparation for Baptism
lesson6.topic1.desc:
Baptism is a saving ordinance that marks the formal beginning of our discipleship. It is performed by immersion in the name of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Ghost.

It represents the death of the old person and the birth of a new life in Christ.
lesson6.topic1.scriptureMain: "We are buried with him by baptism into death" (Romans 6:4).
lesson6.topic1.more.2: Articles of Faith 1:4, first principles and ordinances of the gospel.
lesson6.topic2.desc:
In baptism we promise to take upon us the name of Christ, always remember Him, and keep His commandments. In return, God promises forgiveness of sins and the companionship of the Spirit.

It is a sacred covenant that defines who we are and whom we follow.
lesson6.topic2.scriptureMain: "They are willing to take upon them the name of Christ" (Mosiah 18:8â€“10, extract).
lesson6.topic2.more.1: Doctrine and Covenants 20:37, requirements and covenant.
lesson6.topic2.more.2: "That they may always have his Spirit to be with them" (Doctrine and Covenants 20:77).
lesson6.topic3.desc:
Before baptism we need to develop faith in Jesus Christ, sincerely repent, and begin to live the commandments.

This preparation makes baptism not just a ritual but a real commitment to the Lord.
lesson6.topic3.scriptureMain: "The Lord requireth the heart and a willing mind" (Doctrine and Covenants 64:34).
lesson6.topic3.more.1: "Be ye clean, that bear the vessels of the Lord" (Isaiah 52:11).
lesson6.topic4.desc:
The baptismal interview is a reverent conversation with an authorized leader to confirm that we understand basic teachings and are ready to make covenants.

It is not an exam to condemn us but an opportunity to strengthen our faith.
lesson6.topic4.scriptureMain: Doctrine and Covenants 20:68, supervision of membership.
lesson6.topic4.more.0: "By their fruits ye shall know them" (Matthew 7:20).
lesson6.topic4.more.1: "Examine yourselves, whether ye be in the faith" (2 Corinthians 13:5).
lesson6.topic5.desc:
The day of baptism is a day of spiritual joy. We dress in white, hear testimonies, perform the ordinance, and feel the Lord's love.

It is the beginning of a new stage, not the end of the path.
lesson6.topic5.scriptureMain: "How great shall be your joy" (Doctrine and Covenants 18:13â€“16, adapted).
lesson6.topic5.more.0: 3 Nephi 19, joy after the Savior's ministry.
lesson6.topic5.more.2: "Joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth" (Luke 15:7).
lesson6.topic6.desc:
After baptism we continue learning, serving, and renewing our covenants each week in the sacrament. Progress continues throughout life.

Challenges do not disappear, but now we walk with the power of covenants and the Spirit.
lesson6.topic6.scriptureMain: "Ye must... endure to the end" (2 Nephi 31:20, extract).
lesson6.topic6.more.0: Mosiah 5, the people take upon them the name of Christ.
lesson6.topic6.more.2: "Let us not be weary in well doing" (Galatians 6:9).
lesson6.topic7: The Gift of the Holy Ghost
lesson6.topic7.desc:
After baptism we receive the gift of the Holy Ghost by the laying on of hands. This gift allows us to have the constant companionship of the Spirit if we are faithful.

The Spirit guides, comforts, warns, and strengthens us on the path of discipleship.
lesson6.topic7.scriptureMain: "Ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost" (Acts 2:38).
lesson6.topic7.more.2: Doctrine and Covenants 121:46, the Holy Ghost as a constant companion.
lesson7.title: Preparation for the Temple
lesson7.topic1.desc:
The temple is literally the house of the Lord. It is a holy place, set apart from the world, where we learn more about God's plan and participate in sacred ordinances centered on Jesus Christ.

It is not a place of curiosity but of deep worship.
lesson7.topic1.scriptureMain: "Holiness to the Lord" (ancient temple inscription, Exodus 28:36).
lesson7.topic1.more.1: Doctrine and Covenants 109, Kirtland Temple dedication.
lesson7.topic1.more.2: "My house shall be called the house of prayer" (Matthew 21:13).
lesson7.topic2.desc:
In the temple we make eternal covenants and receive ordinances that are not performed anywhere else. Families are sealed for eternity and work is done for the dead.

The temple is the meeting point between heaven and earth.
lesson7.topic2.scriptureMain: "For mine house shall be called an house of prayer for all people" (Isaiah 56:7).
lesson7.topic2.more.0: "Out of Zion shall go forth the law" (Isaiah 2:3).
lesson7.topic2.more.1: Doctrine and Covenants 124:39, glory in temple ordinances.
lesson7.topic2.more.2: "Blessed are they that dwell in thy house" (Psalm 84:4).
lesson7.topic3.desc:
To enter the temple, we seek to live according to God's commandments: faith in Christ, repentance, chastity, honesty, tithing, and respect for the Word of Wisdom.

Worthiness is not perfection but sincere, consistent effort to live the gospel.
lesson7.topic3.scriptureMain: "Who shall ascend into the hill of the Lord?... He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart" (Psalm 24:3â€“4).
lesson7.topic3.more.0: "Be ye clean, that bear the vessels of the Lord" (Isaiah 52:11).
lesson7.topic3.more.2: "Be ye holy; for I am holy" (1 Peter 1:16).
lesson7.topic4.desc:
A temple recommend is a card signed by leaders confirming that, according to our testimony and conduct, we are worthy to enter the house of the Lord.

The recommend interview is an opportunity to affirm our faith and commitment.
lesson7.topic4.scriptureMain: Doctrine and Covenants 97:15â€“17, promises to those who enter purely.
lesson7.topic4.more.0: "The Lord cannot look upon sin with the least degree of allowance" (Alma 45:16, principle).
lesson7.topic4.more.1: "Come now, and let us reason together" (Isaiah 1:18).
lesson7.topic5.desc:
In the temple, ordinances are performed that relate to our eternal preparation and the salvation of our ancestors. All ordinances point to Jesus Christ and the power of His Atonement.

We speak of them in general terms outside the temple and learn the details inside in a reverent environment.
lesson7.topic5.scriptureMain: Doctrine and Covenants 124:39, ordinances for the glory of God.
lesson7.topic5.more.1: Doctrine and Covenants 128:18, hearts of the fathers and children.
lesson7.topic5.more.2: "Whatsoever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven" (Matthew 18:18).
lesson7.topic6.desc:
In the temple we make additional covenants of obedience, sacrifice, consecration, and faithfulness to the Lord. These covenants deepen our commitment to Jesus Christ.

We do not share details of these covenants outside the temple but live their principles every day.
lesson7.topic6.scriptureMain: "Make a covenant with me" (Doctrine and Covenants 82:15, principle).
lesson7.topic6.more.0: Doctrine and Covenants 58:27â€“28, acting of our own free will.
lesson7.topic6.more.1: "Sell all that thou hast, and follow me" (Luke 18:22, principle of consecration).
lesson7.topic6.more.2: "Ye shall be my people, and I will be your God" (Jeremiah 30:22).
lesson7.topic7.desc:
The temple brings deep peace, spiritual guidance, protection from temptation, and eternal hope. There we feel God's love for us and for our ancestors.

The more we center our lives on the temple, the more we center our lives on Christ.
lesson7.topic7.scriptureMain: "I will dwell in the house of the Lord" (Psalm 23:6).
lesson7.topic7.more.0: "How great shall be your joy" (Doctrine and Covenants 18:16, principle of helping others).
lesson7.topic7.more.1: "They that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength" (Isaiah 40:31).
